section: TERM OF CONTRACT The Term of this Agreement shall be for a period of [* ****] years and [*****] months commencing the 1st day of September 2004 and terminating the [*****] day of [*****].
explanation: The contract term is not clearly defined due to redactions. The lack of specific dates makes it impossible to determine the exact duration of the agreement, which creates ambiguity. Because it is unknown when the contract ends there are inconsistencies on how to enforce the legal obligations within the contract.

section: Notwithstanding paragraphs 4A, 4B and 4C above, CONSULTANT shall not be required to wear ADAMS GOLF [*****] in [*****] ads.
explanation: Due to redactions, this section's meaning is unclear and creates an inconsistency. It is not clear what type of ads the consultant doesn't have to wear Adams Golf gear in. This unclear clause creates ambiguity regarding endorsement obligations and could lead to disputes over the extent of required brand representation. Because the paragraph that it is referencing is unclear due to redactions, this creates ambiguity.

section: During the term of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall use best efforts to wear the headwear and display ADAMS GOLF'S brand name and to demonstrate, discuss and emphasize the newest features of ADAMS GOLF PRODUCT at every opportunity including but not limited to all Senior PGA tour events and promotional and advertising events in which CONSULTANT takes part.
explanation: The phrase 'best efforts' is vague and ambiguous. There's no objective standard to determine what constitutes 'best efforts.' This lack of clarity makes it difficult to enforce this obligation and could lead to disputes over whether the consultant has adequately promoted Adams Golf products.
